places.name: Snow Canyon State Park
places.description: Known for its stunning red and white sandstone cliffs, lava flows, and unique formations. Perfect for hiking, biking, and exploring.

places.name: Red Cliffs National Conservation Area
places.address: 345 E Riverside Dr, St George, UT 84790
places.description: Offers a variety of outdoor activities including hiking, horseback riding, and wildlife viewing. Beautiful desert landscapes.

places.name: Pioneer Park
places.address: 375 Red Hills Pkwy, St George, UT 84770
places.description: A popular spot for picnics, sports, and family gatherings. Features playgrounds, sports fields, and walking paths.

places.name: Red Hills Desert Garden
places.address: 375 E Red Hills Pkwy, St George, UT 84770
places.description: A desert botanical garden showcasing a variety of cacti and other desert plants. Great for a peaceful stroll.

places.name: Sand Hollow State Park
places.description: Ideal for boating, swimming, and off-roading. The park also offers camping facilities and beautiful sandy beaches.

places.name: Gunlock State Park
places.description: A serene spot for swimming, fishing, and boating. The reservoir is surrounded by scenic desert landscapes.

places.name: Cedar Breaks National Monument
places.description: Known for its breathtaking amphitheater of eroded rock formations. Perfect for hiking and enjoying panoramic views.

places.name: Glitter Mountain
places.address: Littlefield, AZ (13 miles south of St. George, just across the Arizona border)
places.description: A small hill with exposed selenite crystal veins. Visitors can collect small crystals and enjoy the unique landscape.
